page.title: 06BLACKROD VILLAGE
page.content: New housing estates have given this once small village a recent surge in growth, boosting its population from 5000 in 1977 to a current total of approximately 10000. Formerly a ribbon development stretching along the A6 road, a by-pass opened in the 1930's; this, and the M61 motorway, now keep all but local traffic away from the village. The former industries of coal-mining and cotton-spinning disappeared many years ago; a small industrial estate with a miscellany of light industry has begun to develop in recent years. Farming is mainly permanent pasture used for grazing dairy cattle.
